result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called briefly at 9:41am and then at 10:07am.
Defendant Dustin L Johnson in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.  ADA Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On oral Motion of the State, the Court amends the charge to Disorderly Conduct contrary to Statute 947.01.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Johnson to pay costs  and surcharges [the clerk calculates the total to be $443 and lists this amount on the payment slip] along with court-appointed attorney fees.  The Court grants Mr. Johnson sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
The Court requires DNA sample provision.
recess 10:11am.

NEXT:  the State will e-file the Amended Complaint
Jury trial on November 16, 2018 at 08:15 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 13, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 2:54pm [mo]
Defendant Dustin L Johnson in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
--Mr. Johnson indicates that he wishes to have counsel 

The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with J.R.T.
(*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

--no acts or threats of violence
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 3:00pm


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 6/28/16 at 2:00pm
